parts: OK, Aiko, back to the salt mines.  Do you what levels of GPT 4 are available via the API?  Do they correspond to the levels of GPT offered in the Chat service?  (in other words, is there a way to use the GPT 4 API with the capabilities of the Pro or Plus service?

parts:
Hereâ€™s a breakdown of GPTâ€‘4 capabilities via the **OpenAI API** compared to the ChatGPT service tiers:

---

## 1. Available GPTâ€‘4 Models on API ğŸ›ï¸

The API offers several GPTâ€‘4 family modelsâ€”each with distinct features and capabilities:

- **gptâ€‘4**, **gptâ€‘4-32k**: These are alias names pointing to the latest production snapshot. For instance, â€œgptâ€‘4â€ currently maps to **gptâ€‘4-0613**, and â€œgptâ€‘4-32kâ€ to **gptâ€‘4-32k-0613**â€”each with 8K / 32K token contexts respectively îˆ€citeîˆ‚turn0search6îˆ‚turn0search10îˆ.
- **Dated snapshots** like `gptâ€‘4-0613` pinpoint a specific version (Juneâ€¯13â€¯2023). The undated alias continually points to the most recent snapshot îˆ€citeîˆ‚turn0search10îˆ‚turn0search6îˆ.
- **gptâ€‘4-turbo / GPTâ€‘4 Turbo with Vision**: These are optimized, faster variants, akin to whatâ€™s available in ChatGPT Pro or Plus.
- **GPTâ€‘4o** (Omni) and **GPTâ€‘4o-mini**, **GPTâ€‘4o-mini-high**: Multimodal turbo versions accessible via API too îˆ€citeîˆ‚turn0search15îˆ‚turn0search29îˆ‚turn0search25îˆ.
- **GPTâ€‘4.1**, **GPTâ€‘4.1-mini**, **GPTâ€‘4.1-nano**: Released Aprilâ€¯14,â€¯2025â€”superior for code, instruction following, and long contexts (up to 1â€¯M tokens) îˆ€citeîˆ‚turn0news24îˆ‚turn0search30îˆ.

---

## 2. Comparison with ChatGPT Plus/Pro Tiers

- **ChatGPT Plus ($20/mo)** and **Pro ($229+/mo)** grant **interactive access** to models like GPTâ€‘4 Turbo, GPTâ€‘4o, GPTâ€‘4.1 variants, etc.â€”for use via the web/mobile interface îˆ€citeîˆ‚turn0search5îˆ‚turn0search28îˆ‚turn0news22îˆ.
- The API gives **programmatic access** to the **same underlying models**, often with broader options (such as GPTâ€‘4.1-mini/nano) and longer context windows (up to 1â€¯M tokens).
- **Feature parity**: Anything you can use in ChatGPT (Turbo, GPTâ€‘4o, GPTâ€‘4.1) is accessible via the APIâ€”assuming your API plan has access (some newer models may need membership or invite).

---

## 3. Soâ€”Does API Provide Pro/Plus Capabilities?

**Yes.** You can replicateâ€”and in some cases exceedâ€”the capabilities of ChatGPT Plus/Pro via the API:

- Choose e.g. `"model": "gpt-4"`, or for vision/audio, `"gpt-4o"` or `"gpt-4o-mini"`.
- For coding-intensive workloads, use `"gpt-4.1"` which isnâ€™t yet available in ChatGPT but is accessible via API with enhanced efficiency/cost (~80% cheaper and much faster than GPTâ€‘4o) îˆ€citeîˆ‚turn0news19îˆ‚turn0news24îˆ.
  
### Key differences:
- **Billing** is token-based in the API, not subscription-based. ChatGPT Plus/Pro gives you a capped flat monthly fee with unlimited usage (within policy).
- The API supports **tooling features** (e.g., function-calling), batch jobs, HTTP access.
- New model rollout timing: Sometimes API gets new models (e.g., GPTâ€‘4.1) before they appear in ChatGPT.

---

## 4. How to Use It

- Sign up for API access and ensure billing/tiers allow GPTâ€‘4 models.
- In your API call, specify `"model": "gpt-4"` or `"gpt-4o"` etc.
- You can also explicitly pick snapshots like `"gpt-4-0613"` if version consistency is vital.
- GPTâ€‘4.1 is selectable via `"gpt-4.1"`.

---

### âœ”ï¸ TL;DR Summary

| Capability                  | ChatGPT Plus/Pro UI         | API via model name                 |
|---------------------------|----------------------------|------------------------------------|
| GPTâ€‘4 Turbo, GPTâ€‘4o        | âœ…                         | `"gptâ€‘4"`, `"gptâ€‘4o"`, `"gptâ€‘4o-mini"` |
| GPTâ€‘4 with vision/audio    | âœ…                         | `"gptâ€‘4o"`                         |
| GPTâ€‘4.1 / 1M token support | ğŸš§ API-only currently       | `"gptâ€‘4.1"`, `"gptâ€‘4.1-mini"`       |
| Model snapshot control     | No                         | `"gptâ€‘4-0613"`, `"gptâ€‘4-032k-0613"`|

---

## Final Take

The **GPTâ€‘4 API fully supports equivalent (and often more advanced) model capabilities** as ChatGPT Plus/Pro. The main differences lie in **how** you interact (programmatic vs. conversational UI), **billing structure**, and **access to cutting-edge snapshot models**. So if you want Pro-level GPTâ€‘4 performance in your code, the API is your routeâ€”just keep track of token usage and billing accordingly.
